==Events==
*[[1528]] &ndash; [[Gustav I of Sweden]] crowned king of [[Sweden]].
*[[1539]] &ndash; Treaty of Toledo signed by King [[Francis I of France]] and [[Holy Roman Emperor]] [[Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor|Charles V]].
*[[1554]] &ndash; [[Bayinnaung]], who would go on to assemble the largest empire in the history of Southeast Asia, is crowned [[List of Burmese monarchs|King of Burma]].
*[[1616]] &ndash; The city of [[Belém]] is founded in [[Pará]], [[Brazil]] by [[Francisco Caldeira Castelo Branco]].
*[[1773]] &ndash; The first public [[Thirteen Colonies|Colonial America]]n [[museum]] opens in [[Charleston, South Carolina]].
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[Mission Santa Clara de Asís]] is founded in what is now [[Santa Clara, California]].
*[[1808]] &ndash; The organizational meeting that led to the creation of the [[Wernerian Natural History Society]], a former Scottish [[learned society]], is held in [[Edinburgh|Edinburgh, Scotland]].
* 1808 &ndash; [[John Rennie the Elder|John Rennie]]'s scheme to defend '''[[St Mary's Church, Reculver]]''', founded in 669, from [[coastal erosion]] was abandoned in favour of demolition, despite it being an exemplar of [[Anglo-Saxon architecture|Anglo-Saxon church architecture]] and [[Anglo-Saxon art#Monumental sculpture and wall painting|sculpture]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; The [[Sicilian revolution of independence of 1848|Palermo rising]] takes place in [[Sicily]] against the [[House of Bourbon|Bourbon]] [[Kingdom of the Two Sicilies]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; The [[Royal Aeronautical Society]] is formed in [[London]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; [[Yohannes IV of Ethiopia|Yohannes IV]] is crowned Emperor of [[Ethiopia]] in [[Axum]], the first imperial coronation in that city in over 200 years.
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[National Trust for Places of Historic Interest or Natural Beauty|The National Trust]] is founded in the [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|United Kingdom]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Itō Hirobumi]] begins his third term as [[Prime Minister of Japan]].
*[[1899]] &ndash; Thirteen crew members and five apprentices are rescued from the stricken schooner ''Forest Hall'' by the [[Lynmouth Lifeboat Station|Lynmouth Lifeboat]] when the former [[Shipwrecking#Instability and foundering|founder]]s off the coast of [[Devon]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; Sir [[Henry Campbell-Bannerman]]'s cabinet (which included amongst its members [[H. H. Asquith]], [[David Lloyd George]], and [[Winston Churchill]]) embarks on sweeping social reforms after a Liberal landslide in the British general election.
*[[1908]] &ndash; A long-distance [[radio]] message is sent from the [[Eiffel Tower]] for the first time.
*[[1911]] &ndash; The [[University of the Philippines College of Law]] is formally established; three future [[President of the Philippines|Philippine presidents]] are among the first enrollees.
*[[1915]] &ndash; The [[Rocky Mountain National Park]] is formed by an act of [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]].
*  1915   &ndash; The [[United States House of Representatives]] rejects a proposal to give women the [[suffrage|right to vote]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Finland]]'s "Mosaic Confessors" law went into effect, making Finnish Jews full citizens.
*[[1921]] &ndash; Acting to restore confidence in baseball after the [[Black Sox Scandal]], Judge [[Kenesaw Mountain Landis]] is elected as [[Major League Baseball]]'s first commissioner.
*[[1926]] &ndash; Original [[Sam 'n' Henry]] aired on [[Chicago|Chicago, Illinois]] radio later renamed [[Amos 'n' Andy]] in [[1928]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[Hattie Caraway]] becomes the first woman elected to the [[United States Senate]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[President of the United States|President]] [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] creates the [[National War Labor Board]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[Caves of Nerja]] are rediscovered in Spain.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[Operation Chopper (Vietnam)|Operation Chopper]], the first American combat mission in the war, takes place.
*[[1964]] &ndash; Rebels in [[Zanzibar]] begin a revolt known as the [[Zanzibar Revolution]] and proclaim a republic.
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] states that the [[United States]] should stay in [[South Vietnam]] until [[Communism|Communist]] aggression there is ended.
*[[1967]] &ndash; Dr. [[James Bedford]] becomes the first person to be [[cryonics|cryonically preserved]] with intent of future resuscitation.
*[[1969]] &ndash; The [[New York Jets]] of the [[American Football League]] defeat the [[History of the Baltimore Colts|Baltimore Colts]] of the [[National Football League]] to win [[Super Bowl III]] in what is considered to be one of the greatest upsets in sports history.
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Biafra]] capitulates, ending the [[Nigerian Civil War]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[Harrisburg Seven]]: Reverend [[Philip Berrigan]] and five others are indicted on charges of conspiring to kidnap [[Henry Kissinger]] and of plotting to blow up the heating tunnels of federal buildings in [[Washington, D.C.]]
*  1971   &ndash; [[All in the Family]] The famous situation comedy premieres on CBS
*[[1976]] &ndash; The [[United Nations Security Council]] votes 11-1 to allow the [[Palestine Liberation Organization]] to participate in a Security Council debate (without voting rights).
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle program]]: Congressman [[Bill Nelson]] lifts off from [[Kennedy Space Center]] aboard [[Space Shuttle Columbia|''Columbia'']] on mission [[STS-61-C]] as a [[Mission Specialist]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Gulf War]]: An act of the U.S. Congress authorizes the use of military force to drive [[Iraq]] out of [[Kuwait]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; Nineteen [[Europe]]an nations agree to forbid [[human cloning]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Downtown Disney (Disneyland Resort)|Downtown Disney]] opens to the public as part of the [[Disneyland Resort]] in [[Anaheim, California]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; The world's largest [[ocean liner]], [[RMS Queen Mary 2]], makes its maiden voyage.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Deep Impact (spacecraft)|Deep Impact]] launches from [[Cape Canaveral]] on a [[Delta II]] rocket.
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Incidents during the Hajj|A stampede]] during the [[Stoning of the Devil]] ritual on the last day at the [[Hajj]] in [[Mina, Saudi Arabia]], kills at least 362 [[Muslim]] [[pilgrim]]s.
*  2006   &ndash; The French warship [[French aircraft carrier Clemenceau (R98)|Clemenceau]] reaches [[Egypt]] and is barred access to the [[Suez Canal]]. [[Greenpeace]] activists board the ship.
*[[2007]] &ndash; Comet [[C/2006 P1]] (McNaught) reaches [[Apsis|perihelion]] becoming the brightest comet in more than 40 years.
*[[2010]] &ndash; The [[2010 Haiti earthquake]] occurs killing an estimated 316,000 and destroying the majority of the capital [[Port-au-Prince]].
